title: Bitcoin’s $200 Billion Selloff: Unpacking the Crash, Causes, and What It Means for Retail Traders
description: It began like any other volatile day in crypto, with Bitcoin flirting around $88,000—a range it had hovered near for days, uncertain but stubborn. By noon in New York, the numbers started bleeding. Prices slumped quietly at first, then with a kind of mechanical violence familiar to anyone who’s watched crypto long enough.
